data.title: India Instruments
data.text:
Tracks:

1. Introduction by Rahat Fateh Ali Khan

2. Man Kunto Maula

3. Allah Hu

4. Lagan Laagi Tum Se

5. Tumhein Dillagi Bhool Jaani Padegi

6. Sanson Ki Mala

Rahat Fateh Ali Khan (* 1974) is a renowned Pakistani singer of Qawwali, a devotional music of the Muslim Sufis. He is the nephew of legendary Qawwal Nusrat Fateh Ali Khan, son of Farrukh Fateh Ali Khan and grandson of Fateh Ali Khan. In addition to Qawwali, he also performs ghazals and other light music and is also popular as a Bollywood playback singer.

Michael Brook (* 1951) is a Canadian guitarist, inventor, producer, and film music composer. He plays in many genres, including rock, electronica, world music, minimalism and film scores. He was nominated for a Grammy Award in 1996 for his production work and as a co-artist on Pakistani singer Nusrat Fateh Ali Khan's album Night Song.
